name: Hilton St. Louis Airport

reviews.text: Used this hotel for a park and fly rate. Did not use their website to book. They wanted over $200, found rate of $134 on www.ParkSleepFly.com
reviews.title: Great for STL airport hotels
Fabulous
reviews.text: STL is hard to find a great hotel for park and fly. This and the Marriott are they best ones.
Nothing special. Room was clean, shuttle ran on time.
reviews.title: Needs to put the Customer back in Customer Service

reviews.text: I'm kind of a hotel snob, I only like to stay at very nice places and we usually pay alot to get that. I was very surprised at what a beautiful hotel this was for the price that we paid. The heavenly beds were so comfortable and the rooms were clean and the staff was very cordial.. The Harrahs casino was 7 miles away and there is a free shuttle that picked us up at the front entrance of our hotel and brought us back. Also free airport shuttle... Thanks Hilton for a great weekend getaway.
reviews.title: Ok For A Hilton

likes.disliked: — Common areas were dirty/no flat screen TV

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights since it was near the airport and convenient for our early departure on Sunday. The good thing is that it was RIGHT NEXT DOOR to our rental car company. The bad news is that we had booked 2 queen beds and they assigned us a king (I like my sister, but not THAT much!). Finally found us what we requested and headed up. Room must have been one of the remodeled ones as it was in very good shape. Beds were very comfortable, but the tub was stained and the toilet wasn't securely bolted to the floor so you got rocked around. Dinner in the restaurant was good. We left about 9 Sat morning to run around and got back about 5:30. Our room had not been cleaned. We stopped at the front desk and told them as we headed out for dinner. We got back about 2 hours later and it still wasn't cleaned. We grabbed our laptops and headed to the lobby and my sister had a chat with the folks at the front desk. We utilized the bar services (Great folks in there!) while we waited. Beware of what the hotel information says about internet service. Service in the rooms is WIRED and they charge for it. The wireless is only in the lobby area and it is free. Overall, I'd rate it average, but we will probably stay somewhere else on our next trip.
reviews.title: Not quite there...

likes.disliked: — The hot tub was very disappointing

reviews.text: Upon check-in my friend and I requested twin beds but were informed that this would require a surcharge so we took the single queen room instead. We did ask for an airport view but this was ignored.
reviews.title: Is this really a Hilton?

reviews.text: The room looked like a standard 2.5* hotel, not what I would expect from a Hilton. On a positive side note, the restaurant staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel...renovations blew me away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for business about a year ago and the hotel was average to better than average for an airport hotel...let me tell you that the renovations they did in between the last time I stayed there have turned this into a new hotel! The lobby is awesome and the service remains high. I was glad to use my HHonor points to pay for this hotel. This is probably the nicest airport hotel I have been in that was not a 5 star property. Worth a look!
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Park and Fly

reviews.text: This was my 2nd stay at thos Hotel. The first was 3 plus years ago. It has improved 100%. The lobby is great, the rooms are all new and very nice. Comfy beds, great lobby bar. Check in was fast and friendly. Check out was the same. Airport shuttle was great and easy. I will be back again if I need another park & fly hotel!!
reviews.title: Not what you expect......worse

reviews.text: Airport Shuttle - Driver was rude and unfriendly.
reviews.title: Restaurant was top notch

reviews.text: I stay at the Hilton(Airport) most of the time when I am in town. Every morning before I head off to my business meetings, I make time for breakfast. Excited to have breakfast one morning and noticed the different staff in the Restaurant. A server named Tanya was missing from the scene. Found out that she is no longer with the Hilton. I do not know what happened, but that girl brought the C out in Customer Service. The Hilton should hire people who understand what customer service is and bring it back to the Restaurant. Needs to be renovated along with the rest of the hotel.
reviews.title: Real Customer Service

reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Hilton Airport and had a good time. The rooms were beautiful. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was clean and inviting. We had an adjoining room which was a huge problem because you could hear into the next room as if there wasn't a wall seperating the two. The occupant next door complained to the front desk that our kids were loud when they were only talking and watching TV like all young kids do. I wouldn't recommend taking children to this hotel, especially if you get an adjoining room. Also, the pool area was filthy, but that may be because there was a huge group of kids in it the night before. The hotel restaurant was superb, and the gentleman waiting tables the night of Jan. 10 2009 was excellent and made us feel so welcome. He was one of the best waiters I have ever had. I would stay here again, but not in an adjoining room.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms, great restaurant service, close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a reservation for a nights stay and park and fly made by our travel agent and a rate set. When my wife went into register she was denied the reservation (number given to her) told they never offered that rate and offered a rate twice the reservation rate. My wife finally got a rate which was $30 higher than our reservation rate. Then I check on my bill on my credit card and its $20 more than my checkout statement!!!!!
reviews.title: Reservations didn't matter

likes.liked: — location, Beach and pool areas, great staff
likes.disliked: — check in and refusal of reservation

reviews.text: On the morning of our flight we had to wait 40 minutes for a shuttle to the airport.
reviews.title: Nice room for STL airport
Nice Hilton Honors Guestrooms- breakfast poor
reviews.text: The Hotel is nice, great rooms but nothing makes up for the problems at the front desk, the refusal to honor a reservation made directly with the hotel, and the over billing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is onder renovation. Be prepared to drag your suitcase in a circuitous narrow hallway from the temporary check-in desk to the elevators. The room had been renovated but the carpet was damaged. The location across from the airport is great for early morning flights. The people dropping us off had to park in a restricted parking area as the only parking is a poorly laid out pay lot.
reviews.title: Under construction

reviews.text: One person working at check in so the process took a very long time. Hotel appeared to be well cared for and clean.
reviews.title: Shocking Television

reviews.text: Room was in good shape. Turned on television and was shocked to find hardcore pornography playing. I often travel with my young children and the first thing they do in a hotel room is turn on the TV. Unsolicited pornography is completely unacceptable for a hotel chain.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Shuttle service to airport was perfect.
reviews.title: This is NOT a Hilton Hotel!

reviews.text: Recently stayed for 4 nights, May 2009. Staff were very accommodating, service at lounge and restaurant was wonderful. Construction is nearing the end and did not affect my stay at all. The final results appear well worth the time spent at the hotel to finish it up.
reviews.title: Quick Overnight

description: The Hilton St. Louis Airport hotel is located next to Lambert International Airport and popular area corporations. The hotel provides a 24-hour shuttle service to the airport and local businesses at no charge. Each of the beautifully appointed rooms is equipped with complimentary WiFi. Plan your next event or meeting and utilize the expansive and versatile meeting space. World's Away restaurant offers casual American fare, and Constellations Bar is a great place to grab a drink after a long day of travel or work.
